title: Global Boundaries Break Down for Movies in U.S. and China
text:
LAGUNA BEACH, Calif.—The surprising box-office success in China of the movie “Green Book” about a white man and black man bonding in the Jim Crow south suggests that superhero and action films aren’t the only content that can prosper there, a top Chinese film executive said.

“The Chinese audience is getting more and more sophisticated,” said Wei Zhang, president of Alibaba Pictures, a division of the Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. that has invested in many movies in recent years including “Green Book.”

...
